he: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּלַט מֵעַל גַּבֵּי גּוּמָּא. גּוּמָּא פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי מַיִם לָאו הַנָּחָה הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
text: Rather, Rava said: Here, it is referring to a case where he gathered the rainwater from on top of a hole filled with water. The Gemara asks: If he gathered it from on top of a hole, it is obvious that it is considered like lifting from a significant place. The Gemara answers: Lest you say that since the water that comes down from the roof into the hole it is water on top of water and, perhaps, it is not considered placing. Therefore, he taught us that collecting water from on top of a hole filled with water is considered an act of lifting an object from its placement.

he: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּלַט מֵעַל גַּבֵּי גּוּמָּא. גּוּמָּא פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא מַיִם עַל גַּבֵּי מַיִם לָאו הַנָּחָה הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
text: Rather, Rava said: Here, it is referring to a case where he gathered the rainwater from on top of a hole filled with water. The Gemara asks: If he gathered it from on top of a hole, it is obvious that it is considered like lifting from a significant place. The Gemara answers: Lest you say that since the water that comes down from the roof into the hole it is water on top of water and, perhaps, it is not considered placing. Therefore, he taught us that collecting water from on top of a hole filled with water is considered an act of lifting an object from its placement.
